title: Franklin punches playoff ticket, 41-13
text:
Franklin punches playoff ticket, 41-13 Franklin punches playoff ticket, 41-13 Post to Facebook Franklin punches playoff ticket, 41-13 Franklin punches playoff ticket, 41-13  //www.hometownlife.com/story/sports/2015/10/24/livonia-franklin-defeats-royal-oak/74523408/   1   Franklin punches playoff ticket, 41-13 Ed Wright 11:18 a.m. EDT October 24, 2015 Denzel Adams takes off on a long gain Friday night. (Photo: NANCY ERWIN) 447 CONNECT 20 TWEET LINKEDIN 1 COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Livonia Franklin's football team is a lot like the red-brick ranch-style homes that populate the neighborhoods surrounding its school — not overly big, but strong and sturdy enough to weather almost any storm. 
The blue-collar Patriots are also playoff-bound for the first time since 2010 after Friday night's emphatic 41-13 victory over host Royal Oak improved their record to 6-3. 
Franklin held a precarious 20-13 halftime advantage before switching into over-drive over the final 24 minutes when they white-washed the Ravens 21-0 down the stretch. 
"Based on the work ethic and chemistry this team has, I thought we had the potential to be a playoff team before the season started," said Franklin head coach Chris Kelbert. "Even though we lost to Stevenson in our opener, I think we got better as the game went on and it gave us confidence. 
"Making the playoffs this season means a lot — because it's been a long time since we made it and because this team works so hard. They deserve this." 
Franklin's first-round opponent will be revealed during Sunday's 7 p.m. MHSAA Selection Show on Fox Sports Detroit. 
The Patriots' will watch the show just like they beat Royal Oak — together. 
Franklin got off on the right foot when Rob Erwin hauled in a 65-yard TD pass from senior quarterback Denzel Adams on the first play of the game. 
After Royal Oak evened the contest at 6-6, the Patriots scored back-to-back touchdowns: the first on a 4-yard keeper by Adams and the second on Chris Nehasil's 2-yard plunge. Jake Giacobbi booted both extra points to give the Patriots a 20-6 advantage before the Ravens scored with six seconds left in the first half. 
Franklin's football team comes together following Friday's playoffs-clinching win over Royal Oak. (Photo: NANCY ERWIN) 
The Patriots received a nice omen on the second-half kick-off when they recovered an unintentional onside kick near mid-field. A few plays later Jacob Clark scored to make it 27-13. 
Adams scored the final two touchdowns for the winners — both in the third quarter. 
Clark had a huge night for Franklin, picking up 172 yards on 14 carries. Adams added 158 yards on 14 attempts. He also completed 6 of 7 passes for 101 yards. 447 CONNECT 20 TWEET LINKEDIN 1 COMMENT EMAIL MORE Read or Share this story: http://www.hometownlife.com/story/sports/2015/10/24/livonia-franklin-defeats-royal-oak/74523408/ TOP VIDEOS
